オプション1: By evening, the four arrived at DirectNex, the coastal cave.
Star Man examined the interior of the cave.

(This doesn't really feel like a cave.
 Not sure if we've got the location wrong
 or what.)

(This spot should be fine.
 With limited entrances, it'll be easier to brace for an attack...
 or so I think.)
Star Man came out of the cave.

"This place looks livable.
 Let's get some sleep for today."

After gathering driftwood at the coastal cave and making a campfire, Square Man fell asleep.
The four rested there.

As Star Man walked along the shore, he found a rock swarming with black shellfish.
He pried one off with a stone axe and went to show Trapezoid Man.
"Are these... mussels?"

"Looks like it, but I don't know...
 I mean, when it comes to black shellfish, mussels are the only kind I know."
"Same here... Let's roast them, then try just a rice-grain-sized chip."
"I'll take that role."
Star Man set a stone beside the fire, placed the shell on it, and roasted it.
After a while, the shell was cooked through.

Trapezoid Man chewed the meat and ate only a tiny fragment.
An hour later, with no issues, he ate a whole piece.
"Mmm—this is way too good!"
"Hope it isn't poisonous, though."
"Ugh, m-my stomach...!"
"Hahaha."

Star Man cleaned the cave alone.
In the trash he found a box of playing cards.
Inside, the deck seemed complete.

When Star Man looked toward the fire, Square Man was asleep,
while Triangle Man and Trapezoid Man were poking the fire with sticks and chatting.
"Found some playing cards."
Star Man sat in front of the fire and handed them to the two.
One hour later.

Square Man awoke,
and Trapezoid Man was teaching poker to Triangle Man and Square Man.
"Which is stronger again, a flush or a straight...?"
"I think it's a flush."
"Oh, Star Man. About those shells earlier—no problems at all."
Trapezoid Man gave a thumbs-up.
"Got it. I'll go get some."

Star Man took a stone axe and a bag and headed for the black shellfish bed.
After that, the four spent their time playing poker while roasting and eating the black shellfish.
